cdf(x)¶

Cumulative Distribution Function

pdf must be defined in the distribution if you want to use the cdf

generate1d(n_packets, randgen=None)¶

Compute random deviates from arbitrary 1D distribution. f_x does not need to integrate to 1. The function normalizes the distribution. Uses Transformation method (Numerical Recipes, 7.3.2)

Parameters:
n_packetsint

The number of random deviates to compute

randgennumpy.random._generator.Generator
Returns:
numpy array of length num chosen from the distribution f_x.
generate_sphere(n_packets, randgen)¶

Create random deviates (longitude, latitude) from a distribution on a sphere

Uses the rejection mechanism to choose random points on the surface according to a specified distribution. Note that the distribution needs to be defined in longitude and sin(latitude) for proper determination on a sphere. Also, the probability distribution function (pdf) in the distribution class must vary between 0 and 1

Find matching records in the database

Tuple of matching doc_ids.
